alert.note: Alert for Prairie (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 10 at 10:17AM CDT until April 20 at 1:00PM CDT by NWS Little Rock
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Arkansas... White River At Des Arc affecting Prairie County. ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Arkansas... White River At Georgetown affecting White, Prairie and Woodruff Counties. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL WEDNESDAY, APRIL 20... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...White River At Des Arc. * WHEN...Until Wednesday, April 20. * IMPACTS...At 24.0 feet, Many acres of farmland flooded within the levees. Water is backing up Bayou Des Arc and Cypress Bayou. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:00 AM CDT Sunday the stage was 24.8 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 24.9 feet Monday evening. It will then fall below flood stage Tuesday, April 19. - Flood stage is 24.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecast 1 PM Crest Location Stg Stg Day/Time Mon Tue Wed Crest Time Date White River Des Arc 24.0 24.8 Sun 9 AM 24.8 24.8 24.8 24.9 7 PM 4/11 &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. River forecasts are based on current conditions and rainfall forecasted to occur over the next 24 hours. During periods of flooding...Evening forecasts are reissued with updated rainfall forecasts. Observed and forecasted stage data plots are available on our Advanced Hydrologic Prediction Service web page at... www.weather.gov/lzk Under the Current Conditions section...Select River and Lakes AHPS.
